sense.name: a strategy or plan, sometimes dishonest
sense.commentary: SCHEME[+system][+strategy][+detailed] Note: implies a purposeful agent
sense.examples: It's a scheme in the Second Act to make the king jealous. That real estate 'opportunity' turned out to be a pyramid scheme. The girls spent hours discussing their schemes and dreams of the future.

sense.name: a configuration of interrelated elements, an arrangement
sense.examples: Mary picked out a new color scheme for her bedroom decor. This poem uses a classical rhyming scheme. The scheme of the house has a two-story entrance hall with library and living room off to each side.
